forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. South southwest wind 8 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny, with a high near 60. South southwest wind 8 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dusk drapes a muted blanket over Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a delicate chill, hinting at the dampness to come through the night. The clouds, heavy and brooding, loom like old sentinels watching from above, promising a possible sprinkle or two. A soft breeze whispers through the streets, tangling with the aromas of the city—perhaps the distant hint of freshly baked bread or roasted coffee mingles with the fresh scent of earth beneath the looming threat of rain. The low temperature of around 54 degrees nudges a reminder to bundle up. A light jacket and perhaps a cozy scarf might make for a much more pleasant venture into the evening.

Looking toward Thursday, the day may deliver a blend of sun and clouds, a playful dance that teases warmth with a peak that dares to reach 60 degrees. Yet the air remains laden with the possibility of rain, with a higher chance of dampness lurking just beneath the horizon. For those who venture out, the day holds the promise of quiet strolls along the waterfront or a sit in a local café, warmed by laughter and the rich comfort of a good book. The sights of the city will pulse with the regular rhythms of life, even if the sun takes its time to break through the clouds. A casual jaunt, perhaps with an umbrella at hand, would perfectly suit the nuances of this urban landscape at this time of day.
